# Exercises for the R-Beginner - The fancy calculator

## Exercise 2
### 2.2
* from https://alexd106.github.io/intro2R/exercise_2.html
```{r myN, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
myNumber <- 12.43

# do some calculations
# natural log
log(myNumber)
#Log2
Log2(myNumber)

#Square Root
sqrt(myNumber)

#Natural antilog
10 ^ (myNumber)
```

### 2.3
* from https://alexd106.github.io/intro2R/exercise_2.html
```{r myN, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
#Area of a circle with diameter 20cm
Area_circle <- ((10^2)*pi)
print(Area_circle)
```

### 2.5

```{r sessionInfo, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
Weight <- c(69, 62, 57, 59, 59, 64, 56, 66, 67, 66)
mean(Weight)
```

### 2.6

```{r sessionInfo, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
var(Weight)
sd(Weight)
print(paste("range of values is", min(Weight),
            "and",
            max(Weight)))
length(Weight)
```

### 2.7

```{r sessionInfo, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
height <- c(112, 102, 83, 84, 99, 90, 77, 112, 133, 112)
summary(height)
some_child <- height[c(2,3,9,10)]
shorter_child <- height[height<99]
shorter_child
```

### 2.8

```{r sessionInfo, echo=TRUE, include=TRUE}
# BMI =  weight (in kg) divided by the square of the height (in meters)
BMI <- Weight/(height/100)^2
BMI
```
